2.text: Do you believe in free speech?

4.text:
Do you believe that people should be judged
by their character, not their skin color?

9.text: Do you believe in freedom of religion?

11.text:
If you believe these things,
you’re probably not a progressive.

16.text:
You might think you’re a progressive.
I used to think I was.

19.text:
My show, “The Rubin Report” was originally
part of the progressive young Turks' network.

24.text: Progressives struck me as liberals but louder.

28.text:
Progressives were the nice guys; they looked
out for the little guy; they cared about women

35.text: In short, who wouldn’t want to be a progressive?

38.text:
But over the last couple of years, the meaning
of the word “progressive” has changed.

43.text:
Progressives used to say,
“I may disagree with what you say,

47.text: but I'll fight to the death for your right to say it.”

51.text:
Banning speakers whose opinions you don’t
agree with from college campuses –

57.text:
Prohibiting any words not approved of
as “politically correct” --

63.text:
Putting “Trigger Warnings” on books, movies,
music, anything that might offend people –

71.text:
All of this has led me to be believe that
much of the Left is no longer progressive,

78.text:
This is one of the reasons I’ve spent so
much time on my show

83.text:
This regressive ideology doesn’t judge people
as individuals, but as a collective.

89.text:
If you’re black, or female, or Muslim,
or Hispanic, or a member of any other minority group,

94.text:
you’re judged differently than the
most evil of all things – a white, Christian male.

99.text:
The Regressive Left ranks minority groups
in a pecking order

103.text: to compete in a kind of Oppression Olympics.

105.text: Gold medal goes to the most offended.

108.text:
Martin Luther King, Jr.’s dream that his
children would be judged by their character

113.text:
and not their skin color was a liberal idea,
but these days, it’s not a progressive ideal.

120.text:
And what about religious freedom - the idea
that no one else can tell you

126.text: Surely progressives still support that basic right.

131.text:
I’m a married gay man, so you might think
that I appreciate the government forcing a

135.text:
Christian baker or photographer or florist
to act against their religion

140.text: in order to cater, photograph, or decorate my wedding.

144.text:
A government that can force Christians
to violate their conscience

148.text: can force me to violate mine.

150.text: If a baker won’t bake you a cake, find another baker.

153.text:
Don’t demand that the state
tell him what to do with his private business.

159.text:
But a government that can force a group of
Catholic nuns - literally called

164.text:
the Little Sisters of the Poor – to violate their faith
and pay for abortion-inducing birth control

170.text: can force anyone to do anything.

177.text:
Today's progressivism
has become a faux-moral movement

183.text:
xenophobia, homophobia, Islamophobia,
and a slew of other meaningless buzzwords

191.text:
The battle of ideas has been replaced
by a battle of feelings,

197.text:
Diversity reigns supreme,
as long as it’s not that pesky diversity of thought.

203.text:
This isn’t the recipe for a free society,
it’s a recipe for authoritarianism.

209.text:
For these reasons, I can no longer call myself
a progressive.

212.text: I don’t really call myself a Democrat either.

215.text:
I’m a classical liberal, a free thinker,
and as much as I don’t like to admit it,

220.text:
defending my liberal values
has suddenly become a conservative position.

225.text:
So, if you think people should be able to
say what they think without being punished for it;

230.text:
that people should be judged by their
behavior, not their skin color;

234.text:
and that people should be able to live
the way that they want to live,

239.text: then there’s not much left on the Left for you.

243.text:
I’ll keep trying to explain that to progressives
until I’m totally left out.

248.text:
I’m Dave Rubin of The Rubin Report
for Prager University.
